turns.content: GDMI 600x600 ZM in hospital lab ATEX 22.

For the hospital lab application, you've selected a GDMI filter housing with 600x600mm dimensions and ZM (ZinkMagnesium) material.Given the hygiene requirements for medical/cleanroom applications, VDI 6022 recommends C5 corrosion resistance. The GDMI housing has C4 corrosion class, but the ZM material provides C5 corrosion resistance, which meets the requirement.The application also involves an explosive atmosphere (ATEX Zone 22). In such environments, static charge on ungrounded filter housings can produce sparks, exceeding the minimum ignition energy of many dust/gas mixtures. To mitigate this risk, all metallic housing components must be grounded/earthed to prevent static discharge. Additionally, anti-static filter media with conductive fibers or grounding strips is required.To finalize the configuration, I need two details:

content_segments.text: For the hospital lab application, you've selected a GDMI filter housing with 600x600mm dimensions and ZM (ZinkMagnesium) material.

Given the hygiene requirements for medical/cleanroom applications, VDI 6022 recommends C5 corrosion resistance. The GDMI housing has C4 corrosion class, but the ZM material provides C5 corrosion resistance, which meets the requirement.

The application also involves an explosive atmosphere (ATEX Zone 22). In such environments, static charge on ungrounded filter housings can produce sparks, exceeding the minimum ignition energy of many dust/gas mixtures. To mitigate this risk, all metallic housing components must be grounded/earthed to prevent static discharge. Additionally, anti-static filter media with conductive fibers or grounding strips is required.
To finalize the configuration, I need two details:
